Technique: FAYENCE; GLAZED; PRESSED IN A FORM/MODEL
Name: Overseer shabti for Neb-mehit
Description: This overseer shabti was made of faience with a glaze in more than one colour. He is wearing a shoulder-length wig and a long white kilt and shirt. The folds in the sleeves were added in black paint. On the front of the kilt is a column of hieroglyphs, with an additional four lines on the rest of the kilt. The legs have broken off at the knees.
